CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 14, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "On The Spot - Last Thursday afternoon, Gladys Thornhill of 2195 Elmore Square, was struck by an automobile driven by Emma T. Blackwell of Houston, Pa., and narrowly escaped being thrown under a moving street car. The motorman clamped on the brakes just in time.  The Courier photographer happened along a few seconds after the accident and came up with this spot picture. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Man bending over injured Gladys Thornhill lying in street beside streetcar
